Source: United Nations Development Programme

Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the data shown in the table?

choices.label: Countries with the highest HDI rankings also have the highest GII rankings.
Countries with high GII rankings are required to have high gross national income per capita.
Countries with the highest HDI rankings do not necessarily have the highest rates of women’s labor-market participation.
Countries with lower GII rankings tend to have longer life expectancies at birth.
Countries with the highest HDI rankings do not necessarily have high literacy rates and levels of education.

content.answer: Countries with the highest HDI rankings do not necessarily have the highest rates of women’s labor-market participation.

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
